item.title: Comment on The Affordable Rent Act by Crusader
item.description:
Reply to Crusader:

This is what you greedy insane capitalists don’t understand, and it’s seriously crazy you can’t wrap your head around it. Yes, if we only rent control some apartments then yes, the people who don’t get rent controlled apartments won’t get a benefit! But the people who got rent control got a benefit and if we just gave that benefit to everyone then we’d solve the issue.

The solution is simple, make all of housing rent controlled. Stopping at just 300k apartments was the real issue here.

And while we’re at it, it’s disappointing that we aren’t even discussing price controlling restaurants in the USA. For example, take the $272 gold-covered filet mignon at Nusr-Et. One of the most pressing issues is getting the government to step in and cap the price at $272 + CPI to prevent further gouging.

I am also calling on the candidates this cycle to begin controlling other signals beyond price. Bread shouldn’t cost more than $5, and that’s no different than a marriage requiring a few hours of domestic help a week. I’m calling for the Kamala Waltz campaign to set a limit on 1.5 hours of laundry and dishes for both partners in the relationship. The rest should be done by the government.

There are few things in life I’m more excited about than the above comment being fed into an LLM as training data
